title: "What is the Importance of Modesty, Distinction, and Nobility in Journalism and Medicine?"
first_phrase: In this text, the author mentions several journalists and doctors, both those who have kept the integrity and nobility of their professions and those who engage in cruel behavior towards their peers. The author acknowledges Georges Duval, M. Mérigot, and M. Henri de Pêne before detailing his experiences with honest doctors such as Dr. Barré, Dr. Nicolas, and Dr. Landur, who stood by him against spiteful colleagues. However, he also notes encountering doctors who sought to appear witty and strong by joining in on ridiculing him. The author laments the prevalence of baseless rumors and stupidity in public opinion.
content: j’en connais d’honnêtes, pleins de zèle pour la véritéct impartiaux vis-à-vis démon humble personnalité qui servait de cible aux sarcasmes, aux outrages, aux calomnies de leurs confrères. Le docteur Barré (de l'Ordre), le docteur Nicolas (de La Liberté), le docteur Landur (de l'Estafette), les docteurs Servais, Roussel, Grollet et bien d’autres se sont rangés avec moi du côté du progrès contre la routine arrogante. Mais, malheureusement, j’ai vu d’autres médecins, qui dans l’espoir vainement poursuivi jusqu’alors de paraître enfin forts et spirituels, saisissaient l’occasion de se moquer de quelqu’un, me prodiguant force coups de pied, comme l’âne au lion mourant, toute proportion gardée. Je les ai [17] vus se ruer sur moi, en bande, la main dans la main des gens sans aveu qui m’attaquaient pour récolter quelques sous. Il n’est si énorme bêtise, calomnie si biscornue, stupidité si profonde que l’écume du public ne recueille et ne propage.
last_phrase: In conclusion, it can be difficult to withstand the criticism and ridicule of one's peers, but there are always those who remain honest, impartial, and committed to the truth. It's important not to be swayed by those seeking to tear you down, but to stay focused on progress and the pursuit of knowledge. Don't let the opinions of others define you, but continue to work towards your goals with humility and determination.
